text: Patient's lab results show glucose: 120 mg/dL, cholesterol: 190 mg/dL, HDL: 45 mg/dL, LDL: 110 mg/dL. Blood pressure was measured at 130/85 mmHg. A1C is 6.2%.
The patient has a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus with an A1C of 7.8%. Recent blood work shows fasting glucose of 145 mg/dL.
Liver function tests reveal ALT: 32 U/L and AST: 28 U/L, which are within normal limits. Total bilirubin is 0.8 mg/dL.
Complete blood count shows WBC: 7.2 x10^9/L, RBC: 4.8 x10^12/L, hemoglobin: 14.2 g/dL, and platelets: 250 x10^9/L.
Lipid panel results: Total cholesterol: 210 mg/dL, Triglycerides: 150 mg/dL, HDL: 42 mg/dL, LDL: 138 mg/dL. Patient advised on dietary modifications.
Kidney function assessment shows creatinine: 0.9 mg/dL and eGFR: 85 mL/min/1.73m2. BUN is 15 mg/dL.
Thyroid function tests indicate TSH: 2.8 mIU/L, which is within normal range. No signs of hypothyroidism or hyperthyroidism.
Patient presents with hypertension. Blood pressure readings consistently above 140/90 mmHg. Currently on lisinopril 10mg daily.
Hemoglobin A1C has improved from 8.2% to 7.1% over the past 3 months with the current medication regimen and lifestyle changes.
Fasting lipid profile shows elevated LDL cholesterol at 155 mg/dL. Patient started on atorvastatin 20mg daily.
